title: ‘Zootopia 2’ Charms CinemaCon As Ke Huy Quan Intros Scenes Of Judy Hopps & Nick Wilde In Therapy With Quinta Brunson’s Dr. Fuzzby
description: Plucky bunny cop Judy Hopps and her erstwhile foil, now partner, fox Nick Wilde got some prime screen time during Disney’s CinemaCon presentation today as a pair of clips were shown from Zootopia 2. The sequel to 2016’s Oscar-winning $1B+ grosser is due for release in the Thanksgiving corridor this year. The first movie followed […]
author: Nancy Tartaglione
byline: Nancy Tartaglione, Anthony D'Alessandro, Jill Goldsmith
excerpt: Disney unveiled new footage from Zootopia 2, the sequel to its 2016 Oscar winning blockbuster, at CinemaCon and featuring Ke Huy Quan and Quinta Brunson
text: Plucky bunny cop Judy Hopps and her erstwhile foil, now partner, fox Nick Wilde got some prime screen time during Disney’s CinemaCon presentation today as a pair of clips were shown from Zootopia 2. The sequel to 2016’s Oscar-winning $1B+ grosser is due for release in the Thanksgiving corridor this year. The first movie followed Judy (Ginnifer Goodwin) as a rookie cop who teams up with con artist Nick (Jason Bateman) to uncover a conspiracy in a titular metropolis of anthropomorphic animals. New cast member Ke Huy Quan was on hand to introduce the fresh Zootopia 2 footage. He joins the follow-up as a snake named Gary, the impetus for Judy and Nick’s next case. This portion of the show was introduced in voice-over by Bateman as Nick, who referred to CinemaCon as “ZinemaCon, Celebrating the Animal Experience” before Quan took the stage. Watch on Deadline RELATED: The 25 Highest-Grossing Animated Films Of All Time At The Box Office Quan called Gary “Zootopia’s first snake” and winked, “Like me, he is terrifying and villainous. … Gary kicks off the whole mystery when he turns up and panics the town.” Judy and Nick take on the case of tracking Gary down, but they are “going through a rough patch,” per Oscar winner Quan, and reluctantly are subjected to partners-counseling sessions with a “therapy animal” aka Dr Fuzzby (voiced by newly announced Quinta Brunson). In the first clip shown, the group-therapy meeting has a number of curiously paired partners — think elephant and mouse — but Judy is in denial that she and Nick have any issues. “We have been partners for one week and we are not dysfunctional at all. … Us being here seems like a misunderstanding,” she says as she nervously thumps her foot. Dr. Fuzzby in turn notes the “disconnected affectation of her emotionally insecure partner.” RELATED: The Movies That Have Made More Than $1 Billion At The Box Office In the second clip shown today, we see Judy and Nick set off to a swamp area where the snake has been sighted and where they meet with a beaver “who has her own way of communicating.”  Zootopia 2 is directed and written by Byron Howard and Jared Bush, who also were on the original. That film was a global phenomenon, grossing $1.026B and scooping the Best Animated Feature Academy Award.  RELATED: Zoe Saldaña Shows Off ‘Avatar: Fire And Ash’ At Disney’s CinemaCon\ RELATED: Marvel At CinemaCon: ‘Thunderbolts*’ Cast Stumbles In From The Casino & Female Silver Surfer Shows Off ‘Fantastic Four’ Footage RELATED: Jeremy Allen White Transforms Into Bruce Springsteen In ‘Deliver Me From Nowhere’ – CinemaCon RELATED: Tom Cruise Returns To CinemaCon To Show Off ‘Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning’
html:
Plucky bunny cop Judy Hopps and her erstwhile foil, now partner, fox Nick Wilde got some prime screen time during Disney’s CinemaCon presentation today as a pair of clips were shown from Zootopia 2. The sequel to 2016’s Oscar-winning $1B+ grosser is due for release in the Thanksgiving corridor this year.

The first movie followed Judy (Ginnifer Goodwin) as a rookie cop who teams up with con artist Nick (Jason Bateman) to uncover a conspiracy in a titular metropolis of anthropomorphic animals.

New cast member Ke Huy Quan was on hand to introduce the fresh Zootopia 2 footage. He joins the follow-up as a snake named Gary, the impetus for Judy and Nick’s next case.

This portion of the show was introduced in voice-over by Bateman as Nick, who referred to CinemaCon as “ZinemaCon, Celebrating the Animal Experience” before Quan took the stage.

Watch on Deadline

RELATED: The 25 Highest-Grossing Animated Films Of All Time At The Box Office

Quan called Gary “Zootopia’s first snake” and winked, “Like me, he is terrifying and villainous. … Gary kicks off the whole mystery when he turns up and panics the town.” Judy and Nick take on the case of tracking Gary down, but they are “going through a rough patch,” per Oscar winner Quan, and reluctantly are subjected to partners-counseling sessions with a “therapy animal” aka Dr Fuzzby (voiced by newly announced Quinta Brunson).

In the first clip shown, the group-therapy meeting has a number of curiously paired partners — think elephant and mouse — but Judy is in denial that she and Nick have any issues. “We have been partners for one week and we are not dysfunctional at all. … Us being here seems like a misunderstanding,” she says as she nervously thumps her foot. Dr. Fuzzby in turn notes the “disconnected affectation of her emotionally insecure partner.”

RELATED: The Movies That Have Made More Than $1 Billion At The Box Office

In the second clip shown today, we see Judy and Nick set off to a swamp area where the snake has been sighted and where they meet with a beaver “who has her own way of communicating.” 

Zootopia 2 is directed and written by Byron Howard and Jared Bush, who also were on the original. That film was a global phenomenon, grossing $1.026B and scooping the Best Animated Feature Academy Award.
